title: 'Good Morning America' won't film live from downtown San Francisco: 'Simply too dangerous'
description: ABC News correspondent Matt Gutman revealed in a segment that he was advised it was too dangerous to film in downtown San Francisco in the early morning.

title: Swedish environmental protesters glue hands to Monet painting, smear paint to protest climate change: video

title: Father's Day: 5 states that are hosting fishing and outdoor recreation events

description: Alex Pietrangelo had more than just winning his second Stanley Cup to celebrate on Tuesday as he was joined on the ice by his daughter, who six months earlier suffered a health scare.

title: Republicans aim to close food stamps 'loophole' costing taxpayers billions
description: House Republicans are trying to closes a loophole in federal law that allows people above certain income caps to still qualify for federal food aid.

title: 'Jeopardy!' producer asks fans to forget 'painful' episode 'ever happened'
description: "Jeopardy!" producer Sarah Foss and former champion Buzzy Cohen broke down a recent challenging episode of the game show that left contestants stumped.

title: Republicans demand answers after top official backs out of hearing on China ahead of Blinken trip
description: House Republicans are demanding answers after a top State Department official canceled a congressional subcommittee hearing ahead of Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s trip to Beijing.

title: San Francisco mayor claps back at leftist official over drug policies: Another white 'savior'
description: San Francisco Mayor London Breed had a heated exchange with a self-described Democratic Socialist over the city's new police crackdown on open-air drug markets.

title: Olympic diver turns to OnlyFans to help pay for training, other expenses: 'It has served me well so far'
description: Mexico Olympic diver Diego Balleza launched an OnlyFans subscription as the country's aquatics federation deals with turmoil with the international governing body.

title: Bride who went viral for making her own wedding cake responds to critics: 'Amazing experience'
description: A bride went viral on Instagram and TikTok for making her own wedding cake — but not all responses were positive. She opened up about her experiences with Fox News Digital.

title: Louisiana Army base named after Confederate general renamed to honor Black WWI hero
description: A Louisiana military base previously named after a Confederate general has been renamed to honor a Black World War I hero and Medal of Honor recipient.

title: Minnesota skyline clouded with smoke from Canadian wildfires; St. Paul now has worst air quality in US
description: After blanketing the northeastern US last week, smoke from the Canadian wildfires has drifted into Minnesota. St. Paul currently has the worst air quality in the country.

title: Closing arguments in Pittsburgh mass shooting suspect's trial set to begin
description: The trial for Robert Bowers, the man who allegedly killed 11 worshippers at a synagogue in Pittsburgh, is coming to an end as closing arguments are set to begin on June 15, 2023.

title: Rescue ships search for hundreds of migrants off coast of Greece following shipwreck
description: A migrant vessel that was carrying 700 to 750 people capsized off the coast of Greece. Rescue ships are still searching for hundreds of missing migrants.

title: 9 more women sue Bill Cosby for alleged drugging, sexual assault
description: Nine more women filed a lawsuit against Bill Cosby in Nevada on Wednesday, claiming he drugged and raped them in various incidents between 1979 and 1992.

title: Amazon may soon offer free wireless phone service
description: Amazon could potentially be coming out with a phone service in the future, but what does this mean for you and your data? Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson explains the details.

title: Biden mocked over 'plans' to build railroad 'across the Indian Ocean’: 'Bold initiative'
description: President Joe Biden was mocked on social media after saying that his government has "plans to build a railroad from the Pacific all the way across the Indian Ocean."

title: Man in Seattle shoots and kills eight months pregnant woman at traffic stop
description: A woman who was eight months pregnant was fatally shot in Washington at a Seattle traffic stop. The motivation behind the shooting remains unclear.

title: University to cut ties with Chinese Confucius Institute after GOP scrutiny on $17M DOD grant
description: Alfred University will cut off its China-backed Confucius Institute following scrutiny of the university receiving a $17 million defense grant.

title: California first responder sentenced for selling fatal dose of fentanyl to hospital coworker
description: A former Southern California first responder was sentenced to more than three decades in prison for selling fentanyl to a coworker who died the following day in Las Vegas.

title: Indictment of Marine veteran Daniel Penny 'defies logic,' says local NY official: 'Something rotten'
description: Nassau County Executive Bruce Blakeman slammed the 'rotten' Daniel Penny indictment, telling 'Fox & Friends' co-host Brian Kilmeade that the charges "defy logic."

title: CNN signals return to partisan era with coverage of Trump indictment: ‘Aura of divisiveness is back’
description: The firing of former CNN CEO Chris Licht has led to “an aura of divisiveness" and signaled a return to liberal opinion, according to media watchdogs.

title: Soros DA's handling of deadly Austin mass shooting still 'causing distress' two years later: victim's brother
description: The family of a man killed in one of the worst mass shootings in Austin, Texas, history says the Soros-funded DA has failed to deliver justice.

title: Rod Stewart is leaving rock ‘n’ roll: 'Everything has to come to an end sooner or later'
description: Rock legend Rod Stewart announced he's making a pivot in music genre and switching to swing music. The "Maggie May" singer noted that he's not retiring.

title: Michigan woman who fled to Thailand after allegedly killing MSU student with her car enters no-contest plea
description: Tubtim “Sue" Howson, a 57-year-old dual U.S. and Thai citizen, has pleaded no contest in the hit-and-run death of a Michigan State University student.

title: Race continues for most Mount Everest ascents between 2 Sherpa guides, Pasang Dawa to climb next year
description: Veteran Sherpa guide Pasang Dawa who's climbed Nepal’s Mount Everest 27 times is planning to make another ascent next year in an attempt to match record-holder Kami Rita.

title: Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers says he won't sign budget if GOP lawmakers cut funding for UW diversity officers
description: Tony Evers, the governor of Wisconsin, claims he will not sign the state budget if Republicans cut funding for diversity officers at the University of Wisconsin.

title: Video shows killer whale near Spain biting rudders off boat
description: A person on a catamaran traveling through the Strait of Gibraltar near Spain has captured on video another incident of a killer whale damaging a boat.

title: Amazon may soon offer free wireless phone service
description: Amazon prime subscribers may soon be able to receive a low-cost or free wireless phone service as Amazon is currently in talks with several phone carriers.

title: Former Indiana congressman convicted of insider trading seeks to avoid prison ahead of upcoming sentencing
description: Steve Buyer. a 64-year-old former congressman who was convicted of insider trading, is attempting to avoid prison time at his upcoming sentencing. He was convicted in March.

title: Ex-Google chief built 'oligarch-style empire' to influence AI, Biden White House and public policy: report
description: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt has developed a network of investments and relationships that's allowed him to influence Washington, D.C., according to a new report.

title: Germany gives $1.4 billion to Holocaust survivors across the world
description: Holocaust survivors across the globe will receive $1.4 billion in compensation next year, according to an organization working on behalf of Jews who suffered under Nazi Germany,

title: Philippines struck by deep 6.2 magnitude earthquake
description: An earthquake with a magnitude of 6.2 has struck a part of the Philippines. No major damage or injuries were immediately reported as the deep quake occurred 75 miles below the surface.

title: 26-year-old man released from IN prison after being misidentified as suspect who started fire in jail's lobby
description: A man who was misidentified as the suspect who started a fire in an Indiana jail has been released. No one was injured in the fire, which was quickly extinguished.

title: 2 Americans found dead in hotel room in Mexico's Baja California
description: Two Americans visiting the Mexico Baja California village of El Pescadero reportedly have been found dead in a hotel room, according to reports.

title: Wisconsin Legislature passes bipartisan plan to prevent Milwaukee from going bankrupt
description: Lawmakers in Wisconsin passed a plan that will attempt to prevent Milwaukee from going bankrupt. The plan will also send more aid to every community in the state.

title: Dems, anti-Trumpers collaborate to fight third party effort that sees growing support
description: Democrats and Never-Trump Republicans are collaborating to counteract No Labels' potential third party presidential candidate, as polls show voters dissatisfied with both political parties

title: As Athletics inch toward Vegas move, Green Day singer joins boycott and Tom Hanks says 'damn them all to hell'
description: Billie Joe Armstrong and Tom Hanks have both reacted in recent weeks as the Oakland Athletics appear near to relocating to Las Vegas.

title: Missing Chicago man's family suspects 'foul play' after he disappeared from concert
description: Noah Enos was last seen at a concert venue in Chicago on Monday evening. His family believes his phone died around 10 p.m., and he never made it home from the show.

title: North Korea launches ballistic missiles into Sea of Japan, neighboring nations say
description: North Korea reportedly fired ballistic missiles into the Sea of Japan on Thursday evening, its latest warning shots to neighboring Japan and South Korea.

title: Pennsylvania police arrest woman in connection with district attorney's office shooting
description: Pennsylvania police arrested a woman in connection with a shooting that occurred in the district attorney's office, according to state police.

title: Pennsylvania House passes measure to raise phone bill fees for millions in bid to help fund 911, 988
description: In a bid to help emergency communication centers and the 988 hotline, Pennsylvania's House passed a bill raising the phone bill fees for millions of residents on June 14, 2023.

title: You know CNN is bad, but it won’t even do this
description: CNN ignores the Hunter Biden/Joe Biden scandals like Burisma even when government won't take action for five years. But network certainly covers Trump investigations.

title: Woman in Japan arrested for spraying people with unidentified liquid inside department store restroom
description: Authorities in Japan have arrested a woman accused of injuring several people, including an 85-year-old, by spraying an irritating liquid at them inside a department store restroom.

title: Biden admin sued over Buttigieg's jet records, man wins lawsuit against Facebook and more top headlines
description: Biden admin sued over Buttigieg's jet records, man wins lawsuit against Facebook and more top headlines

title: Nationals manager brings photo evidence to press conference after controversial call costs team game
description: Washington Nationals manager Dave Martinez was irate after a controversial call to end the team's game against the Houston Astros on Wednesday.

title: Homer Jones, former NFL star credited as first player to spike football after TD, dead at 82
description: Homer Jones, a two-time Pro Bowl wide receiver for the New York Giants and Cleveland Browns, has died after a battle with lung cancer. He was 82.

title: Couple shocks sister-in-law by making their pets 'flower girl' and 'ring bearer' in place of children
description: A Reddit user who's planning her wedding is asking others on social media if it's controversial to make her dog and cat the "flower girl" and "ring bearer," instead of her niece and nephew.

title: Armed Florida man confronts squatter who took over house while he was overseas: police
description: An alleged squatter was arrested in Florida after the homeowner got back from a months-long trip abroad and confronted the man with a firearm.

title: TikToker reportedly fakes his own death, then returns to funeral in helicopter: ‘Welcome to my funeral’
description: A TikTok star reportedly played a prank on his own family, faking his death and appearing at his funeral in a helicopter, according to The Times U.K.

title: Appeals court denies bail for self-exiled Chinese businessman awaiting fraud trial
description: The 2nd Circuit Court of Appeals in Manhattan denied bail for Guo Wengui, a Chinese businessman who is awaiting trial in a $1 billion fraud case.

title: Sweden vows to crack down on organized crime as gangs grow to 'breathtaking' numbers
description: Sweden has vowed to combat the country’s crime networks by introducing new legislation. The number of people involved in organized crime was described as “breathtaking."

title: Scientist who discovered whales can sing dies at the age of 88
description: The scientist who discovered that whales could sing, Roger Payne, has died at the age of 88. Payne made the discovery during a trip to Bermuda in 1967.

title: Oregon GOP-senator's boycott over bills on gun safety, abortion may be ending soon
description: Republican senators in Oregon have been boycotting for the past six weeks due to bills on abortion, transgender health, and gun safety. There is optimism the protests will end soon.

title: Abortion, Trump won’t hurt Republican turnout in 2024, says female GOP lawmaker
description: Rep. Ashley Hinson flipped a Democrat-held seat in 2020 and won by an even larger margin in 2022.

title: Tori Bowie's agent speaks out after Olympian's death: 'Would have handled everything differently'
description: Following the tragic death of U.S. Olympic gold medalist Tori Bowie during childbirth, her agent, Kimberly Holland, described how much she was looking forward to being a mother.

title: WNBA star A’ja Wilson takes issue with Joe Biden's congratulations to Golden Knights
description: President Biden took to Twitter to congratulate the Vegas Golden Knights on Thursday. But Las Vegas Aces star A'ja Wilson appeared to take offense to it.

title: Treat Big Tech like Big Tobacco to protect our kids
description: A surgeon general's warning on smoking ushered in momentous change in America. Now, a new surgeon general is warning us about Big Tech's dangerous impact on our children.

title: Ex-CDC chief 'very disappointed' in how Fauci handled hunt for COVID origin
description: Former Centers for Disease Control & Prevention Director Robert Redfield sounded off on Dr. Anthony Fauci's remarks from a February interview on coronavirus.

title: Philadelphia woman's Uber ride takes dramatic turn after driver is shot in the head, crashes into pole: police
description: An Uber passenger in Philadelphia survived after a stray bullet entered the vehicle, striking the driver in the head and causing it to crash. The driver is not expected to live.

title: Barr dismisses 'farcical' Trump presidential records defense, says he committed 'outrageous obstruction'
description: Ex-Attorney General William Barr, who worked for Presidents Trump and George H.W. Bush, sounded off on 'Special Report' against certain arguments being made.

title: Country singer claims venue canceled gigs because she sang the National Anthem at a Trump event
description: Country singer Carly Tefft claimed that her engagements at a Massachusetts venue were canceled because of her performance at a Trump rally in the spring.

title: Pat Sajak 'Wheel of Fortune' rumored successor Ryan Seacrest was prepped for game show success by Dick Clark
description: Ryan Seacrest may be poised to host "Wheel of Fortune" after his mentor and friend, Dick Clark, helped pave the way for the future broadcasting legend.

title: Biden admin hit with lawsuit for stonewalling Pete Buttigieg's government jet records
description: A government watchdog group is claiming the Federal Aviation Administration has stonewalled information about Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg's use of government jets.

title: Oklahoma officials warn suspect who shot 4, killing 1, fled the scene: 'armed and dangerous'
description: The Tulsa Police Department warned the community to remain vigilant after a suspect who is believed to have shot four people, killing one, fled the scene.

title: Newsom owns another California crisis along with the homeless problem
description: Newsom owns another California crisis along with the homeless problem. State’s mental health issues make homelessness worse and are linked to the prison system.

title: 'Twisted Sister' frontman rejects 'transphobe' slur for opposing gender surgery on minors: 'Not gonna take it'
description: In an interview with Fox News, former "Twisted Sister" frontman Dee Snider addressed the cancellation effort he faced for his stance against minor gender surgery.

title: Texas officials say 'deceased body' found was actually a dismembered sex doll
description: The Harris County Sheriff’s Office in Texas responded to a call of a deceased body found in a yard. When officials arrived at the home, they made a strange discovery.

title: Trump, drawing more criticism on the right, could slow-walk the trial
description: The media is spelling the end for former President Donald Trump yet again, this time with GOP peers taking more brazen shots at the controversial candidate.

title: Country duo Larkin Poe champion sobriety, mental health in music with 1 Million Strong initiative
description: Larkin Poe's Rebecca and Megan Lovell back 1 Million Strong's initiative to support 1M people in addiction recovery by 2025. They shared thoughts on sober positivity and mental health advocacy.

title: GOP senators demand Biden comply with COVID origins transparency law as deadline approaches
description: Sens. Josh Hawley, R-Mo., and Mike Braun, R-Ind., sent a letter to President Biden demanding he comply with the COVID-19 Origin Act of 2023 by the June 18 deadline.

title: 'Our country needs help': Americans in nation's biggest blue city grade President Biden's performance
description: Americans in New York City were asked to grade President Joe Biden's performance as he seeks re-election. Here's what they think of the president's job so far.

title: Artificial intelligence won't likely reach human-like levels without this one key component, study finds
description: Artificial intelligence platforms can mimic human learning, but will likely not match human-like cognition unless the programs are connected to robots, study finds.

title: Italian prince explains decision to renounce throne to fashion model daughter, 19
description: The House of Savoy in Italy will see a new leader in Prince Emanuele Filiberto's daughter, Vittoria, 19, when he passes the title to her.

title: California's Lightning Motors is building 'organic' motorcycles with AI
description: Lightning Motorcycles has started using a generative AI-based computer-aided design system from AutoCAD to engineer its electric high-performance motorcycles.

title: Several AI tools are available that can turn text into video in minutes
description: AI can take text and quickly create video based off the words typed into the software. This can be done to create both short animations and longer videos.

title: Artificial intelligence may change labor market but doesn't need to cause long-term harm
description: Although the growth of AI might appear unsettling, considering that many rely on their jobs for economic stability, it does not necessarily spell disaster for the workforce.

title: Iran expanding influence 'with impunity' in America's backyard, congresswoman says
description: Iran has increasingly cooperated with Latin American countries by developing closer ties and deals, particularly Venezuela on oil shipments, in order to expand influence in the region.

title: Georgia man sues Facebook and wins after platform denied access to his account, personal photos: report
description: Jason Crawford, a lawyer from Columbus, Georgia, sued Facebook after he claims the company denied him access to his own account and refused to hear his appeal.

title: LAURA INGRAHAM: The entire indictment narrative has been skewed
description: Fox News host Laura Ingraham breaks down the indictment of former President Donald Trump in the ongoing classified documents case on "The Ingraham Angle."

title: GREG GUTFELD: Democrats lied and 'cried Trump' before, now 'it's hard to care'
description: Fox News host Greg Gutfeld criticizes the media for its bias against former President Donald Trump by accusing them of damaging their credibility by broadcasting untruths.

title: SEAN HANNITY: The 'media mob' refuses to hear any perspective that doesn't validate its left-wing fantasies
description: Fox News host Sean Hannity highlights a double standard in the media's coverage of former President Donald Trump's indictment and allegations then-Vice President Joe Biden was involved in a bribery scheme.

title: On this day in history June 15, 1864, Arlington National Cemetery is established in Virginia
description: The creation of Arlington National Cemetery, on this day in history, June 15, 1864, began with the seizure of Robert E. Lee's Virginia home after he defected to the Confederacy in the Civil War.
